messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Suggestions for websites for almost 7 yr old to make own computer games
messages.msgSnippet: Roblox.com Its free. It is easy! He can make games with scripting or not. MD s characters are (he is 6) mario555555 TYLERMCBROAD greystripewarrior
messages.messageBody:
Roblox.com
Its free. It is easy!
He can make games with scripting or not.
MD's characters are (he is 6)
mario555555
TYLERMCBROAD
greystripewarrior
FLAMERIDER64II
He plays more with mario555555 and has made more games under him.
You can make one game per character free , if you want more than you have to get the menbership ( not expensive)
There are lots of pirates games in it and lots of youtube movies of Roblox.
If he joins send us a friend request and a message!

 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/
 
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Suggestions for websites for almost 7 yr old to make own computer games
messages.msgSnippet: My son and his friend have used Game Maker- they are older but maybe your son could do it with help. Pretty sure this is a free download- Google it- Heather
messages.messageBody:
My son and his friend have used Game Maker- they are older but maybe
your son could do it with help. Pretty sure this is a free download-
Google it-

Heather

alohabun wrote:
>
> Hi - Wondering if anyone has any suggestions for websites for my son
> Li to make his own computer games. He can read a few words on his own
> and I can help him with the rest. I just asked him what kind of game
> he is most interested in making and he said "fighting. Like Pirates
> of the Carribean." Well, if anyone has any suggestions, we'd love
> them! Thanks! Laurie
>

messages.subject: Suggestions for websites for almost 7 yr old to make own computer games
messages.msgSnippet: Hi - Wondering if anyone has any suggestions for websites for my son Li to make his own computer games.  He can read a few words on his own and I can help him
messages.messageBody:
Hi - Wondering if anyone has any suggestions for websites for my son
Li to make his own computer games. He can read a few words on his own
and I can help him with the rest. I just asked him what kind of game
he is most interested in making and he said "fighting. Like Pirates
of the Carribean." Well, if anyone has any suggestions, we'd love
them! Thanks! Laurie
